measure.name: process_single_speed_air_source_heat_pump
measure.display_name: Set Residential Single-Speed Air Source Heat Pump
measure.description: This measure removes any existing HVAC components from the building and adds a single-speed air source heat pump along with an on/off supply fan to a unitary air loop. For multifamily buildings, the single-speed air source heat pump can be set for all units of the building. See https://github.com/NREL/resstock#workflows for supported workflows using this measure.
measure.modeler_description: Any supply components or baseboard convective electrics/waters are removed from any existing air/plant loops or zones. Any existing air/plant loops are also removed. A heating DX coil, cooling DX coil, electric supplemental heating coil, and an on/off supply fan are added to a unitary air loop. The unitary air loop is added to the supply inlet node of the air loop. This air loop is added to a branch for the living zone. A diffuser is added to the branch for the living zone as well as for the finished basement if it exists.

argument.name: seer
argument.description: The installed Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio (SEER) of the heat pump.

argument.name: hspf
argument.description: The installed Heating Seasonal Performance Factor (HSPF) of the heat pump.

argument.name: eer
argument.description: EER (net) from the A test (95 ODB/80 EDB/67 EWB).

argument.name: cop
argument.description: COP (net) at 47 ODB/70 EDB/60 EWB (AHRI rated conditions).

argument.name: shr
argument.description: The sensible heat ratio (ratio of the sensible portion of the load to the total load) at the nominal rated capacity.

argument.name: fan_power_rated
argument.description: Fan power (in W) per delivered airflow rate (in cfm) of the outdoor fan under conditions prescribed by AHRI Standard 210/240 for SEER testing.

argument.name: fan_power_installed
argument.description: Fan power (in W) per delivered airflow rate (in cfm) of the outdoor fan for the maximum fan speed under actual operating conditions.

argument.name: min_temp
argument.description: Outdoor dry-bulb temperature below which compressor turns off.

argument.name: crankcase_capacity
argument.description: Capacity of the crankcase heater for the compressor.

argument.name: crankcase_temp
argument.description: Outdoor dry-bulb temperature above which compressor crankcase heating is disabled.

argument.name: eer_capacity_derate_1ton
argument.description: EER multiplier for 1.5 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: eer_capacity_derate_2ton
argument.description: EER multiplier for 2 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: eer_capacity_derate_3ton
argument.description: EER multiplier for 3 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: eer_capacity_derate_4ton
argument.description: EER multiplier for 4 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: eer_capacity_derate_5ton
argument.description: EER multiplier for 5 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: cop_capacity_derate_1ton
argument.description: COP multiplier for 1.5 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: cop_capacity_derate_2ton
argument.description: COP multiplier for 2 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: cop_capacity_derate_3ton
argument.description: COP multiplier for 3 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: cop_capacity_derate_4ton
argument.description: COP multiplier for 4 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: cop_capacity_derate_5ton
argument.description: COP multiplier for 5 ton air-conditioners.

argument.name: heat_pump_capacity
argument.description: The output heating/cooling capacity of the heat pump. If using 'autosize', the autosizing algorithm will use ACCA Manual S to set the heat pump capacity based on the cooling load. If using 'autosize for max load', the autosizing algorithm will override ACCA Manual S and use the maximum of the heating and cooling loads to set the heat pump capacity, based on the heating/cooling capacities under design conditions.

argument.name: supplemental_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the supplemental electric coil.

argument.name: supplemental_capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the supplemental heater. If using 'autosize', the autosizing algorithm will use ACCA Manual S to set the heat pump supplemental heating capacity.

argument.name: dse
argument.description: Defines the energy losses associated with the delivery of energy from the equipment to the source of the load.
